q: Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Mr. Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of "Googled- The End of the World As We Know It." "I think Eric Schmidt is burned out." There have been signs Mr. Eric Schmidt would prefer doing something

out in terms of jobs for the future, not jobs for the past," said Senator Chuck Schumer ( D- New York). "Whether it be here at GE or up in Luther Forest." If we can beat Russia in the race to the moon, we can beat China in the race to green energy and that's what this is about, said Senator Kirsten Gillibrand ( D- New York). "It's about being competitive. It's about creating opportunity for growth in a growing sector and I think the President's speech really hit the mark.

One sign pointing to a gubernatorial campaign is that he's already scheduled to speak during at least nine GOP county dinners in Indiana this winter and spring. Certainly if a person was going to be running for president of the United States, I think he'd probably be doing more Lincoln Days in Iowa and New Hampshire than he would in Indiana. That's just the pure reality of the matter, said Howard County GOP Chairman Craig Dunn , who has lined up Mike Pence to speak at a dinner in Kokomo on March 22. Dallas Morning News: Attempts to rein in homeowners associations have failed in the state Legislature for more than a decade, but a rise in HOA foreclosures and a spate of public lawsuits have invigorated supporters, who see this session as their chance for reform. Legislators have filed a handful of bills that curtail HOA powers, including limiting their ability to foreclose on property and ending bans on solar panels. HOA proponents agree that the system needs review, but promise to push back at changes that threaten associations' authority. Politico: "To understand the dissatisfaction on the right with the current crop of Republican presidential hopefuls, look no further than Mike Pence . Here is a link to the BBC biography and here is the Downing St release: The Prime Minister has appointed Craig Oliver, currently Controller of BBC Global News, as the Director of Communications at 10 Downing Street. The Prime Minister said: "I am very pleased that Craig Oliver is to become the new Director of Communications at 10 Downing Street. Craig has formidable experience as a broadcast journalist. He will do an excellent job in explaining and communicating the Government's programme. Craig Oliver said: "I'm delighted to be joining David Cameron and his team at such an exciting and challenging time. "It's difficult to leave the BBC after a fascinating few years
